Filter output clusters and remove cells beloging to those clusters

Source: R/filter_clusters_and_remove_cells.R
filter_clusters_and_remove_cells.Rd

The function works in a similar way to filter_clusters but it also removes the cells belonging to those clusters

filter_clusters_and_remove_cells(x, ncells = 10, abundance = 0.03)

Arguments

x

Rcongas object
ncells

minimum size of a valid cluster expressed as absolute number of cells
abundance

minimum size of a cluster expressed as a percentage of the total cell number

Value

Examples


x = Rcongas::congas_example

print(x)

#> ── [ Rcongas ] My CONGAS model n = 503 cells with i = 70 segments, grouped in k 
#> ● Cluster c1, n = 379 [75.35% of total cells].
#> ● Cluster c2, n = 124 [24.65% of total cells].
#> 
#> ── CNA highlights  
#> ✓  4 CNA(s):  chr14:93300001:105450000, chr15:67050001:102600000, chr16:1:3750000, and chr18:32400001:55950000
#> 
#> ℹ Model scored with AIC = 577427.35
#> ● Differential Expression analysis for 1 vs 2 with the DESeq2 method: 212 DE
#> genes at level alpha 0.01, with |lfc| > 0.25.

x = x %>% Rcongas:::filter_clusters_and_remove_cells(ncells = 150)

#> ! Filtering 1 cluster due to low cell counts or abudance
print(x)

#> ── [ Rcongas ] My CONGAS model n = 503 cells with i = 70 segments, grouped in k 
#> ● Cluster c1, n = 379 [100% of total cells].
#> 
#> ── CNA highlights  
#> ! None found!
#> 
#> ℹ Model scored with AIC = 577427.35
#> ● Differential Expression analysis for 1 vs 2 with the DESeq2 method: 212 DE
#> genes at level alpha 0.01, with |lfc| > 0.25.
